main event: A radar return was reported as a planet by Vandus Yahnkin in Brooklyn, New York.
interesting points: The radar return was observed for 15 minutes.
The report mentions a letter from Brooklyn, New York about an unidentified flying object that crossed the sky, along with a smaller object that remained more or less stationary above it.
The letter writer was unable to identify the object, as it was much smaller than a normal jet fighter or bomber and seemed to be moving at a high rate of speed.

Another letter mentions an object that appears in the sky every evening over Flushing, New York, moving in a straight course from west to east and disappearing below the horizon. The object appears to be illuminated from within.
The Air Force provided a response to the letter writer, indicating they had reviewed the file and it contained a report of an unidentified flying object sighting.
location: Brooklyn, New York; Flushing, New York
